intro: Carex × silesiaca, commonly known as the Silesian sedge, is a hybrid plant in the Carex genus, belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. This plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as marshes, wetlands, and along the edges of ponds. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions for ornamental or ecological purposes. The botanical features of Carex × silesiaca make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and botanical study.
